availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Pruett (Frankfort, Kentucky, printer, sgt at arms, and constable)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, tailor, printer, and sergeant-at-arms. Kentucky native. Married to Amaryllis A. Conover Pruett in Fayette County, Kentucky, on May 29, 1839. Father of James Pruett, John W. Pruett, Walter Pruett, and Emma Pruett. Merchant tailor in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Franklin County in 1850. Constable in Frankfort in 1854. Printer in Frankfort in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Frankfort in 1860. Sergeant-at-arms of the Senate of Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1861 through 1863. Constable in Frankfort from 1862 to 1864.
